titleStmt.title: URFA-184
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: What is the ǧāyfe? – The ǧāyfe, master Stephan, the ǧāyfe is sold at the druggist’s shops. Like this, something like jelly; like jelly, like paste. Let’s say, it is like a paste.
Similar to this; it is reddish and its smell is bad. We buy it here to get rid of the bad spirit.
It breaks the magic; if one of us… We are Muslims here, thank God, many thanks!
It is true that we are Muslims, but when it comes to magic, I mean, some women whose luck is bad, they say, “My husband wants to marry against me (i.e., a second wife).”
She then goes to a sheikh and gives him two or three hundred million, even five hundred million. The sheikh fools her.
He goes ahead (saying), “I will make an amulet for you. I will write you an amulet, so your man would love you and won’t marry against you.”
The good and the evil is all from God, the generous. Everything, the good and the evil is from God’s order.
I mean, I personally do not accept the amulet; I mean, I do not accept (the role of) the sheikhs when it comes to magic. God forbid!
But when it comes to piety and worship in the mosque I respect them, since we are Muslims, thank God.
But a sheikh’s (duty) is his (reading the) Quran and (writing with) his pen. When he does magic, when he starts to do magic, he becomes a magician and I do not approve such a sheikh.
As for the Lord of the Worlds, in his glory and majesty, his verses cannot be sold or bought with money. The verses of the Quran have no price, master Stephan!

I mean, not even a single word of the Quran has an equivalent value in money. This is just the Quran. The Lord of the Worlds sent it down, He sent it down with His hands to the beloved (Muhammad). How do you, sheikh, (dare to) write (amulets) and deal it with money?
As for the ǧāyfe, we buy it here when they say that someone is afflicted with magic. Let’s say, a spell has occurred, something has happened with him.
They roll it in a cigarette, in tobacco, in smuggled tobacco. We tear it into small little pieces and then we put it into a cigarette.

We roll it. The one who smokes tobacco smokes it and thus produces smoke in the room which dispels the magic. The magic then goes away from the house. They also put it, let’s say, on a plate. They put only a little bit on an ugly plate which is no longer needed.
You put it on the plate; you put it on the gas cooker like that and burn it. Then smoke comes out of it and that smoke breaks the magic.
It dispels the magic, I mean, we use it against magic. We buy the ǧāyfe at the druggist’s shops, it is sold at drugstores, (for example) at the druggist ʕĪse.
We buy… Amīne buys it for us like this, just a small amount: five or ten grams for five millon, for five liras.

Sometimes she buys it for us to fumigate, because we are very much afraid of bad spirits. We have bad spirits here around us (since we have) our daughters and our business. The people here are very envious. There is a lot of envy around here among the people. Enjoy it!
